Intervention: Gemcitabine: 1000 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), day 1 and day 8 x 2 cycles Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 2 cycles
Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), day 1 and day 8 x 2 cycles Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 2 cycles
Eligibility: Histologically and/or cytologically confirmed breast cancer
Has received adjuvant/neoadjuvant chemotherapy for breast cancer with anthracycline
Have at least one measurable region
Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status: 0-1
To have an adequate function of the organ (bone marrow, liver and kidney function)
To have pore pneumonia or pulmonary fibrosis
Within 28 days of the last chemotherapy or radiotherapy, 14 days after the last hormone/immunotherapy or 7 days after the surgery
• have severe complication (heart infarction, infection, drug hypersensitivity or diabetes)
Results: The best response recorded from the start of treatment to progression or recurrence of disease using the solid tumour response assessment criteria (RECIST) defines when participants improve ("response"), remain the same ("stable") or worsen (" progression") during treatment.
Time frame: basis for measuring progressive disease
Description of the arm/group: Gemcitabine: 1000 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), day 1 and day 8 x 2 cycles Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 2 cycles
Unit of measure: Participants Complete response: 0
Description of the arm/group: Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), day 1 and day 8 x 2 cycles Paclitaxel: 175 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 2 cycles
Unit of measure: Participants Complete response: 0
